block.p: Lat$(7$)in$(7$)is$(7$)ta / (lat in es ta) / n. / a neologism for a maté-drinking, milonga-dancing gringa enamored of all things Latin American, as in, ''She's become such a Latinista since her trip to Buenos Aires that she's taken to converting prices into pesos. Poor dear, I don't have the heart to tell her those gaucho pants make her hips look as wide as the Pampas.''

Ice / (ês) / n. / water frozen in the solid state: ''I wish the French would learn to put ice in their drinks''; [slang] diamonds; in an age of global warming, an increasingly rare natural luxury sought out by travelers, e.g., ''Now that the snowcaps are melting, ice is the new ice.''

Fron$(7$)tier / (frun tir ) / n. / a border; a wilderness next to a settled area of a country: ''The individualism of the frontier is alive in Deadwood''; a trend for dangerous travel to uncharted areas, e.g., ''Festival au Désert in Mali is the last frontier in musical adventures,'' or / adj. / ''Next winter, I'm definitely game for a frontier vacation, like a dog-sledding trip in the Yukon.''
